title: February 23, 9 am news update: Kashmir attack- 3 jawans, woman killed, UP Polls Live Updates, SP Candidate’s son, 3 others injured
text:
India news February 23, 9 am news update: Kashmir attack- 3 jawans, woman killed, UP Polls Live Updates, SP Candidate’s son, 3 others injured February 23, 9 am news update: Kashmir attack- 3 jawans, woman killed, UP Polls Live Updates, SP Candidate’s son, 3 others injured Three jawans and a woman were killed after terrorists attacked a patrolling party in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir, according to TV reports. Four other army personnel were injured in the ambush. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 23, 2017 10:06 AM Three jawans and a woman were killed after terrorists attacked a patrolling party in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir. Representative image 
3 jawans, woman killed in terrorist attack on patrolling party in Jammu and Kashmir’s Shopian 
Three jawans and a woman were killed after terrorists attacked a patrolling party in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir, according to TV reports. Four other army personnel were injured in the ambush. The woman was killed in firing. Three of the injured personnel were stated to be critical. Security forces have cordoned off the area and search operations are on. According to a recent report, the army has lost 26 soldiers in the line of duty in Jammu and Kashmir in the first two months of 2017, while the security forces have stepped up the heat against militants, killing 22 ultras in 50 days — the highest since 2010. 
Read More 
Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Phase 4 Polling Live Updates: Voting begins for 53 seats 
Polling for the fourth phase of seven-phased Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 has started today. Parties are contesting today for 53 assembly constituencies spread over 12 districts including the poverty-hit Bundelkhand region and Congress party’s home turf Rae Bareli. For the first time since 1998, Congress president Sonia Gandhi couldn’t campaign for her party in the district which she also represents in the Parliament. Some other districts going to the polls in the fourth phase include Pratapgarh, Kaushambi, Allahabad, Jalaun, Jhansi, Lalitpur, Mahoba, Banda, Hamirpur, Chitrakoot and Fatehpur. There are as many as 680 candidates in the fray and their fate would be decided by 1.84 crore voters. The maximum number of 26 candidates are in Allahabad North, while only six candidates are in the fray in Khaga (Fatehpur), Manjhanpur (Kaushambi) and Kunda (Pratapgarh). 
Read More 
UP elections 2017: SP candidate’s son, 3 others injured in clash with BSP supporters 
Four persons, including Samajwadi Party candidate Siddhgopal Sahu’s son were injured after party workers and supporters of the ruling party in the state and BSP clashed during phase 4 polling for Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017, according to ANI report. Polling for the fourth phase of seven-phased Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 has started today. Parties are contesting today for 53 assembly constituencies spread over 12 districts including the poverty-hit Bundelkhand region and Congress party’s home turf Rae Bareli.
